conclusion: To determine how shadows A, B, and C change when the light source moves to the right, we need to consider both their positions and sizes.
A is the shadow of the birdcage, B is the shadow of the small white object, and C is the shadow of the brown object.
As the light source moves to the right, shadows will shift to the left because the direction of shadows is opposite to the direction of the light source.
The size of the shadows may increase slightly if the light source moves further away horizontally due to the increased angle of incidence.
Shadow A (birdcage) will move to the left, and its circular shape may elongate slightly depending on the angle.
Shadow B (small white object) will move to the left, and its elongation will depend on the new angle of the light source.
Shadow C (brown object) will move to the left, and its shadow may elongate slightly.
When the light source moves to the right, shadows A, B, and C will shift to the left, and their sizes may increase slightly depending on the angle of the light source.
